meanings.definition: The act of swallowing or passing through the throat.
meanings.sent1: After taking a big gulp of water, the throating of the liquid was smooth and effortless.
meanings.sent2: The throating of the pill was challenging for the child who found it hard to swallow.
meanings.sent3: The throating of the spaghetti was comical as it seemed to have a mind of its own, twisting and turning.
meanings.sent4: Her throating of the truth was evident in the way she swallowed her words, unable to speak up.
meanings.sent5: The throating of fear gripped her as she tried to swallow her nervousness before the speech.

meanings.definition: The action of engaging in oral sex.
meanings.sent1: The throating of the food was enjoyable as they savored each bite of the delicious meal.
meanings.sent2: He was surprised by the sudden throating of the joke, making him burst into laughter.
meanings.sent3: The throating of the ice cream cone was messy but delightful on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent4: Her throating of the song lyrics was flawless as she sang along to her favorite tune.
meanings.sent5: The throating of the secret made her feel uneasy, unsure of how to handle the sensitive information.
